actions.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure.

actions.committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Environment and Natural Resources.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Executive Comment Requested from Interior.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Subcommittee on Environment and Natural Resources Discharged.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries
actions.text: Executive Comment Received from Interior.
Reported by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. H. Rept. 103-169.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 65.
Mr. Studds moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate.

actions.committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Environment and Public Works.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Environment and Public Works
actions.text: Committee on Environment and Public Works. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Environment and Public Works. Reported to Senate by Senator Baucus without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 235.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Public Law No: 103-134.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Environment and Natural Resources

official_title: To designate the Pittsburgh Aviary in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania as the National Aviary in Pittsburgh.

summary.text: Designates the Pittsburgh Aviary in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, as the National Aviary in Pittsburgh.

titles.title: To designate the Pittsburgh Aviary in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania as the National Aviary in Pittsburgh.
